title: How to Make Your Bathroom Comfortable in Winter

steps.headline: Buy a rug to put down on the floor.
steps.description: Make sure it's a rug made specifically for bathrooms, but not a plastic bathmat. Try to get a soft one, so it's comfortable to walk on. Make sure it's absorbent.

steps.headline: Purchase a wall coat rack to hang robes and dressing gowns on.
steps.description: You can either get ones to drill onto a door or a wall, or stick-on ones which are less permanent. Try to put one up close to your bath / shower so you can grab your robe easily and put it on before getting out of the shower.

steps.headline: Get a shower radio.
steps.description: Music will wake you up in the mornings, if you're the type of person who wakes up tired.

steps.headline: Light some scented candles.
steps.description: It's essential to pick warm scents, as they smell better in winter. Try cinnamon, festive spice, wood, or berries. You could buy flameless candles for a safer option, which still give off scent and flicker, but aren't actually lit. Make sure you put any real candles on a safe, flat surface away from anything flammable.

steps.headline: Buy a chair if your bathroom is spacious enough.
steps.description: Make sure it's comfortable, and place it in a place where it won't get wet. Showers can be pretty tiring in winter, especially if you've only just woken up, so sitting in a chair for a little while afterwards can be relaxing. But make sure you don't get too comfortable or go back to sleep if you have work or school.

steps.headline: Dry your towels in a tumble-dryer if possible, as leaving them outdoors in cold weather can make them crunchy and stiff.
steps.description: If you do dry them outside, make sure you use a fabric conditioner when washing them, and heat them up on a heated towel rail before getting out of the bath or shower.

steps.headline: Place some flowers in your bathroom, either real or fake.
steps.description: Flowers are nice in any season, but are particularly cheerful in the dull months.

steps.headline: Keep your towels in a linen box in your bathroom.
steps.description: Purchase a small wicker basket with a lid, or decorative storage box. You could also keep a pair of comfortable socks or slippers in there to keep your feet warm when you get out of the bath or shower.
